revised_title: Electromagnetic Theory and Aether Research in 1893
tldr: This article presents a summary of various research papers and discussions on electromagnetic theory, aether, and related phenomena. It mentions Mr. Heaviside's work on rotational aether, Professor J. J. Thomson's method of representing electric fields, and Professor Oliver Lodge's search for a magnetic field's effect on light velocity. Additionally, it highlights William Gannon's research on copper electrolysis in vacuo and Arthur Schuster's communication on the same topic.
